Programme



General Info

The Trento-Innsbruck Quantum Information Tour is finally coming back!

The event will have a focus on Bose-Einstein Condensation, Nanoscience, Quantum Optics and Quantum Information. The language of the talks will be English.
Students will be given lectures on forefront theoretical and experimental research in this fields by academics and prominent figures in Trento and Innsbruck environment.

The event will start in Innsbruck with ...

You can find the detailed program below, which is subject to change and will be constantly updated.

Partecipation fee and requirements

  • In order to sign up for the event you must be an AISF or IAPS member
  • Participation fee is different whether you need the accommodation in Trento:
  • Fee is 40€ without accomodation in Trento
  • Fee is 130€ with included accomodation in Innsbruck for the night of Monday and Tuesday and in Trento for the nights of Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.
  • Such fee will cover Thursday's and Friday's lunches and dinners, all breakfasts, local transportation in Trento, the train to Innsbruck and the accomodation in Innsbruck and Trento
  • Participants who need to arrive and sleep in Innsbruck on Sunday 18th, and/or to leave from Trento on Sunday 25th, can contact the Organising Committee, who will help find a suitable accomodation for the extra night(s).
  • Please notice that participation fees does not cover the following:
  • Journeys to Innsbruck and from Trento to arrive at the event and leave once it is concluded
  • .
  • Insurance
  • Note: if you are Italian and you are not an AISF member yet you can become an AISF member at this link.
  • Note: if you are not Italian and you are not an IAPS member, please contact your National Committee for your IAPS registration.
  • Please note that unfortunately we are not able to provide scholarships and/or bursaries for any students at this time.
Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica

The Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica (AISF) gathers together most of the Italian physics students. It was founded in Heidelberg in August 2014 and since January 2015 is a National Committee for the International Association of Physics Students (IAPS).
